frontMatter.title: Feedback
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to ask users for feedback via the Medallia feedback button and form.
frontMatter.intro: VA asks users of VA.gov for feedback via a feedback button and form provided by Medallia, enabling sentiment feedback collection across modernized pages.

when_to_use.value: **Every modernized VA.gov page.** Consistently offer feedback capability on every modernized page.
**Page bottom placement.** Position the feedback button at the bottom of the page, alongside other footer-area elements.

design_principles.value: **Consistent placement.** The feedback button should appear in the same location on every page.
**Coordinate with other elements.** Maintain consistent spacing with back-to-top button and last-updated date when present.
**Return focus after submission.** After displaying confirmation, return focus to the button.

examples.title: Desktop feedback button
examples.description: Feedback button at the bottom of content on full-width and search results pages.

examples.title: Mobile feedback button
examples.description: Feedback button accessible on mobile viewports.

examples.title: Modal form
examples.description: Three-question survey that appears when users click the button.

how_to_build.intro: The feedback pattern uses Medallia to collect user sentiment.

steps.value: Position the Medallia feedback button at the bottom of main content.
Coordinate placement with back-to-top button and last-updated date when present.
Maintain consistent spacing regardless of which elements are present.
Trigger modal form on button click.
Display confirmation screen post-submission and return focus to button.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The feedback pattern is powered by Medallia integration.

**Research findings:**
- Moving button from sidebar to main content increased submissions 84-1,280% across tested pages
- 54-60% of participants looked in footer first when searching for feedback options

See the Medallia integration documentation for implementation details.

accessibility.value: Previous sticky sidebar placement created 508 compliance issues; relocation to main content resolved accessibility barriers.
The button must be keyboard accessible.
Focus must return to the button after the modal is closed.
Screen magnification users may miss bottom-placed buttons, but research showed this is still the preferred location.
